DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study examine effect consensus public health recommend level physical activity [ moderate physical activity ( MOD-PA ) = 150 min/wk ] versus high dose physical activity [ high physical activity ( HIGH-PA ) = 250 min/wk ] context comprehensive behavioral weight loss program include reduction energy intake measure cardiovascular function use cardiac MRI biomarkers vascular disease risk . Each exercise dose compare independently Diet Only group intervention propose primary secondary outcome , MOD-PA also compare HIGH-PA . This study involve recruitment 390 overweight obese adult randomly assign one condition ( Diet Only , MOD-PA , HIGH-PA ) period 12 month . The primary outcome LVM measure cardiac MRI . Secondary outcome include additional cardiac MRI measure ( aortic pulse wave velocity , end diastolic volume , aortic distensibility ) , inflammatory marker ( CRP TNFα ) select adipocytokines ( adiponectin ) biomarkers risk relate vascular outcome , body weight , body composition , cardiorespiratory fitness , traditional CVD risk factor ( lipid , glucose , insulin , blood pressure ) . Additional secondary analysis allow examination effect physical activity independent weight change primary secondary outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Exercise Weight Loss Cardiovascular Health
DOC.detailed_description: Current estimate indicate excess 65 percent adult United States overweight ( BMI > 25.0 kg/m2 ) least 30 percent adult classify obese ( BMI > 30 kg/m2 ) . Overweight obesity link numerous chronic condition include cardiovascular disease . The application cardiac MRI ( CMRI ) allow direct measurement cardiac structure , leave ventricular mass ( LVM ) assess CMRI show predictive cardiovascular disease . Recent study show LVM decrease weight loss ; however , lack information add benefit physical activity weight loss direct measure cardiovascular structure function . Thus , consistent PA-09-243 , study examine effect two recommend dos physical activity combine dietary intervention change propose outcomes cardiovascular disease risk overweight adult . The primary aim study examine effect consensus public health recommend level physical activity [ moderate physical activity ( MOD-PA ) = 150 min/wk ] versus high dose physical activity [ high physical activity ( HIGH-PA ) = 250 min/wk ] context comprehensive behavioral weight loss program include reduction energy intake measure cardiovascular function use cardiac MRI biomarkers vascular disease risk . Each exercise dose compare independently Diet Only group intervention propose primary secondary outcome , MOD-PA also compare HIGH-PA . This study involve recruitment 390 overweight obese adult randomly assign one condition ( Diet Only , MOD-PA , HIGH-PA ) period 12 month . The primary outcome LVM measure cardiac MRI . Secondary outcome include additional cardiac MRI measure ( aortic pulse wave velocity , end diastolic volume , aortic distensibility ) , inflammatory marker ( CRP TNFα ) select adipocytokines ( adiponectin ) biomarkers risk relate vascular outcome , body weight , body composition , cardiorespiratory fitness , traditional CVD risk factor ( lipid , glucose , insulin , blood pressure ) . Additional secondary analysis allow examination effect physical activity independent weight change primary secondary outcome .
DOC.criteria: 1855 year age . Body mass index ( BMI ) 25.0 < 40.0 kg/m2 . Ability provide inform consent prior participation study . Females currently pregnant breastfeed , report planning pregnancy within next 12 month . History bariatric surgery . Report current medical condition treatment medical condition could affect body weight . These may include follow : cancer ( Note : Persons previously diagnose nonmelanoma skin cancer , successfully treated cancer remain diseasefree five year would eligible participation study ) ; diabetes mellitus ; hyperthyroidism ; inadequately control hypothyroidism ; chronic renal insufficiency ; chronic liver disease ; gastrointestinal disorder include ulcerative colitis , Crohn 's disease , malabsorption syndrome ; etc . Current congestive heart failure , angina , uncontrolled arrhythmia , symptoms indicative increase acute risk cardiovascular event , prior myocardial infarction , coronary artery bypass graft angioplasty , condition require chronic anticoagulation ( i.e . recent recurrent DVT ) . Resting systolic blood pressure > 160 mmHg rest diastolic blood pressure > 100 mmHg . Eating disorder would contraindicate weight loss physical activity . Alcohol substance abuse . Currently treated psychological issue ( i.e. , depression , bipolar disorder , etc ) , take psychotropic medication within previous 12 month , hospitalize depression within previous 5 year . Report exercise > 3 day per week > 20 minute per day past 3 month . ( NOTE : It important individual sedentary enter study allow maximal effect intervention . ) Report weight loss > 5 % participate weight reduction diet past 3 month . Report plan relocate location accessible study site employment , personal , travel commitment prohibit attendance least 80 percent schedule intervention session schedule assessment .
